data.event: Cerro Colorado was established around 1855 by Charles D. Poston, who owned the Sonora Exploring & Mining Company in Tubac, Arizona.
The post office was established on April 17, 1879, and closed on April 15, 1911.

event.title: 1861, fifteen Mexican and native American men were killed

data.event: In 1861, fifteen Mexican and native American men were killed after being buried alive in their shaft when the roof caved in.
At about the same time in 1861, Charles Poston left the mine for business elsewhere, he left his brother John Poston in charge.
